annotations.title: Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline
Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline
Gold rebounds from over one-month low on weaker dollar
Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline

Gold rises on weaker dollar, tariff uncertainty before deadline
Gold set for second weekly loss; US inflation data in focus

content.text:
**Executive Summary**

Gold prices have experienced volatility over the past week, influenced by a weakening U.S. dollar, geopolitical developments, and investor sentiment shifts. As of July 1, 2025, gold is trading at approximately $3,322.55 per ounce, marking a 0.6% increase from the previous day. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rises-weaker-dollar-tariff-uncertainty-before-deadline-2025-07-01/?utm_source=openai)) This analysis delves into recent price actions, major news events, technical indicators, economic drivers, institutional activities, market sentiment, and provides an outlook for gold investors.

**Price Action**

On July 1, 2025, spot gold prices rose to $3,322.55 per ounce, up 0.6% from the previous day. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rises-weaker-dollar-tariff-uncertainty-before-deadline-2025-07-01/?utm_source=openai)) U.S. gold futures also increased by 0.8% to $3,334.80. Over the past week, gold has rebounded from a one-month low of $3,290 per ounce, influenced by a weaker U.S. dollar and easing geopolitical tensions. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rebounds-over-one-month-low-weaker-dollar-2025-06-30/?utm_source=openai))

**Major News Events**

- **Weaker U.S. Dollar:** The U.S. dollar index fell by 0.2%, reaching a three-year low, making gold more attractive to investors holding other currencies. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rises-weaker-dollar-tariff-uncertainty-before-deadline-2025-07-01/?utm_source=openai))

- **Trade Tariff Uncertainty:** Investors are cautious ahead of President Donald Trump's July 9 tariff deadline, with potential tariffs ranging from 10% to 50% if bilateral trade deals are not achieved. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rises-weaker-dollar-tariff-uncertainty-before-deadline-2025-07-01/?utm_source=openai))

- **Middle East Ceasefire:** A ceasefire between Iran and Israel has reduced geopolitical risks, diminishing gold's appeal as a safe-haven asset. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rebounds-over-one-month-low-weaker-dollar-2025-06-30/?utm_source=openai))

**Technical Analysis**

Gold is currently trading above the key support level of $3,250. A breach below this level could lead to a decline towards $3,200. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rebounds-over-one-month-low-weaker-dollar-2025-06-30/?utm_source=openai)) The Relative Strength Index (RSI) indicates neutral momentum, suggesting potential for both upward and downward movements.

**Economic Drivers**

- **Federal Reserve Policy:** President Trump has urged the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates, comparing U.S. rates to those of Japan and Denmark. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-rises-weaker-dollar-tariff-uncertainty-before-deadline-2025-07-01/?utm_source=openai)) This political pressure may influence future Fed policies, impacting gold prices.

- **Inflation Data:** Investors are awaiting U.S. Core Personal Consumption Expenditure data, with analysts forecasting a 0.1% monthly increase and a 2.6% annual rise. ([reuters.com](https://www.reuters.com/world/india/gold-heads-second-weekly-loss-investors-eye-us-inflation-data-2025-06-27/?utm_source=openai)) These figures could influence expectations for Federal Reserve policy adjustments.

**Institutional Activity**

As of June 30, 2025, gold futures on the COMEX market had an estimated volume of 147,511 contracts, down from 228,118 contracts on the previous trading day. Open interest stood at 434,141, reflecting an increase of 1,593 contracts. ([apnews.com](https://apnews.com/article/3ab4a8d47a9598d0c9933fe95e49da82?utm_source=openai)) This indicates sustained investor interest in gold futures.

**Market Sentiment**

The market sentiment is currently mixed. While a weaker U.S. dollar and geopolitical uncertainties support gold prices, easing tensions and potential Federal Reserve policy changes may limit significant upward movements.

**Outlook**

In the near term, gold prices are likely to be influenced by upcoming U.S. economic data releases, Federal Reserve policy decisions, and geopolitical developments. Investors should monitor these factors closely, as they will provide insights into potential price movements.

**Risk Disclaimer**

Investing in gold involves risks, including market volatility and potential loss of principal. Investors should conduct thorough research and consider their risk tolerance before making investment decisions.
